result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Brossard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Attempt Capture an Image of Nudity, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Attempt Capture an Image of Nudity, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
No working cameras.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims.
Register as a sex offender for 8 yrs as long as he abides by all rules.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur & concur to prison on ct 1.

Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any of the victims identified in the complaint.
- Defendant shall not be at Sun Tan City on E Campus Mall in Madison, WI.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Michelle L Viste appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
